title: Recreate precisionlasernw.com content as a new site branded "Built Rite Creations"

requirements.text: Recreate a public marketing website whose page structure, sections, and written content match the current content found on https://precisionlasernw.com, but with the company name changed everywhere to "Built Rite Creations".

quotes: I want to create a website with the same content as precisionlasernw.com but change the company name to Built Rite Creations.

acceptanceCriteria: All user-visible pages/sections present on https://precisionlasernw.com are represented in the new app (including navigation and footer links).

All occurrences of the original company name on the recreated pages are replaced with "Built Rite Creations" (including headings, paragraphs, meta title/description, footer copyright, and any call-to-action text).
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement the recreated site as a responsive, accessible UI (mobile/tablet/desktop) with working navigation between pages/sections and sensible SEO defaults (document titles per page and a global meta description).
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation elements route correctly to their corresponding pages/sections without broken links.
Layout remains readable and usable on mobile and desktop screen sizes.
Each route/page has a non-empty document title and the app includes a meta description.

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) that fits a construction/woodworking/industrial craftsmanship brand for "Built Rite Creations" and use it consistently across the entire site (avoid default-looking template styling).
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across header, footer, and all sections (typography scale, button styles, and spacing feel unified).
Color palette and typography clearly communicate an industrial/craft brand aesthetic (not a generic default template look).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/immutablePaths (compose existing UI components instead).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend functionality if it is required for the requested marketing site.
Do not include third-party auth providers; only Internet Identity is supported if authentication is later needed.
nonGoals: Building an admin/CMS for editing site content.
E-commerce, payments, checkout, or customer accounts.
Integrations with external databases or third-party backends.
